title: Squid Ink Pasta With Shrimp and Scallops

Directions
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat until lightly smoking. Add shrimp and sauté until opaque, about 1 minute each side. Remove to a plate. Reheat oil and cook the scallops until they too are opaque and lightly browned, 2 minutes each side. Remove scallops to plate with shrimp and add garlic to pan. Cook, stirring often, until golden, about 2 minutes. Add red pepper flakes, salt, black pepper, wine, tomato, and parsley, and cook over high heat until reduced by half, 8 to 10 minutes. Add lemon juice and butter and return seafood to the skillet, mixing well. Keep warm.
Cook pasta in the pot of salted water until it is al dente. Drain well, return to the pot along with the seafood. Toss well, and serve immediately.
Serious Eats / Deborah Mele
Notes
Squid ink pasta
can be found in Italian specialty stores or online (we recommend squid ink pasta from Rustichella D'Abruzzo).
